intro: Photinia integerrima, commonly known as the glossy leaf photinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage that has a glossy appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers in spring, which are followed by red, fleshy fruits that are edible for certain bird species. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Photinia integerrima is also valued for its ability to tolerate a range of soil conditions and its relatively disease-resistant nature.
